info.heading: Properly
info.subtitle: Software Engineer
info.description: Most of my work has been related to SEO, and two of my favourite projects so far have been the release of Area Landing Pages to capture location keyword search traffic, and "Real Estate, Explained" as an indexable content hub. I do like seeing our search numbers go up üìà

cards.alt: A billboard along a desolate looking road, featuring the Property Brothers, behind a traffic sign. The billboard text reads Feel at home while buying a home. properly.ca

info.heading: Gobble
info.subtitle: Senior Software Engineer
info.description: On a small team of 5 engineers (including our CTO), I worked directly with members of the CS, marketing and culinary teams to action on their pain points with our internal site (from setting menus to campaigns to resolving user issues), as well as building new features to accompany our improved food product offerings.

cards.alt: A picnic blanket with the text Gobble on it.

info.heading: Connected
info.subtitle: Software Engineer and Engineering Manager
info.description: In addition to my responsibilities as an engineer, I was a house captain in Connected's house system, I captained the Connected volleyball team and I used to run a recurring remote trivia quiz show. I also helped plan engineering guild initiatives and Connected's "Labs" program, as well as mentorship and recruitment initiatives.

cards.alt: Drum set in front of a brick wall with coloured lights shining at it. The Connected logo is displayed on the wall.

info.heading: Flipp
info.subtitle: Junior Software Engineer
info.description: I was on the team that actioned on retailer customizations, working with the team that maintains the flyer framework that lives on retailer websites. Since I had many of the same responsibilities as a full time employee, I also helped with onboarding new engineers and attending recruitment events.

cards.alt: Image of Fan standing in front of a background of repeating maple leaves and the Flipp logo, wearing a Canada flag headpiece.

info.heading: University of Toronto, St. George Campus
info.subtitle: Bachelor of Applied Sciences in Computer Engineering
info.description: During my undergrad, I was involved in many different of student life. I worked at the university as a residence don and in the engineering offices. I helped with engineering outreach and recruitment in different ways - general volunteering, being a panelist at events and being a residence advisor at the Girls Leadership in Engineering Experience weekend.

cards.alt: A group of graduates in graduation gowns standing on the grass against the background of University College at U of T.

info.heading: PillPal: an IoT multi-pill dispenser and management tool
info.subtitle: ASP.NET Core, C#, ReactJS
info.description: Our team developed a consumer focused hardware and software solution to improve medication adherence in the elderly. We were selected for the CNIB Hochhausen Prize for Excellence in Accessible Design in Engineering for People who are Blind or Partially Sighted as well as Certificate of Distinction for Excellence in Design Project.

cards.alt: Four people in matching shirts around a poster board, laptop and pill bottles.

info.heading: Smart Charger @ YHack 2016
info.subtitle: Android, Arduino
info.description: Our team of two worked on creating a hardware controlled Android application that would monitor a phone's battery level to stop charging at a user-selected percentage.

cards.alt: Two students standing behind a laptop with the number 88 in front. Fan is on the right, holding a smartphone.

info.heading: Huawei Seeds for the Future, Canadian Delegate
info.description: I was one of 18 delegates across Canada selected for an immersive two-week cultural and technical lab program in China to understand the roles of Canada and China in the global ICT market.

cards.alt: A group of students in hotel lobby, in front of a Huawei Seeds for the Future sign. The guys are standing or kneeling, and the girls are sitting on the floor.

info.heading: Staying active
info.subtitle: Volleyball, Ultimate Frisbee, Dragonboat, Weightlifting
info.description: These days I mostly just lift heavy things in my basement (gunning for that 3 plate squat and 1 plate bench). I did dragonboat for two years and played intramural volleyball and ultimate frisbee throughout high school and university. In my graduating year, I received the Julie Wilkinson Award for the Engineering Athletics Association for achievement in intramural athletics.

cards.alt: Closeup of a dragonboat with paddlers inside, holding up their paddles at an angle. Fan is wearing sunglasses and sticking her tongue out.
